title: (x) slab serif from Men's Health Magazine - Popular {Stephen}
content:
I know it's a crappy picture but can anyone give me the name of the slab serif and/or alternatives. It's has to be different from the vere used – but great – Glypha, Serifa, Rockwell etc.

See it at: [http://imgs.zinio.com/magimages/115942081/2007/221437591\_toc1.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150131042354/http:/imgs.zinio.com/magimages/115942081/2007/221437591_toc1.jpg "http://imgs.zinio.com/magimages/115942081/2007/221437591\_toc1.jpg")

I like Enclave ( [http://www.terminaldesign.com/fonts/sets/?CID=6](http://web.archive.org/web/20150131042354/http:/www.terminaldesign.com/fonts/sets/?CID=6 "http://www.terminaldesign.com/fonts/sets/?CID=6")) but I'm really not so mad about the new Soho that everyone seems to be raving about. ( [http://www.fonts.com/FindFonts/RecentReleases/2007/Soho.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20150131042354/http:/www.fonts.com/FindFonts/RecentReleases/2007/Soho.htm "http://www.fonts.com/FindFonts/RecentReleases/2007/Soho.htm"))

Thanks
author: peter_monrad

comments.content: Seb Lester has done some good stuff, but I don't really get Soho either (sometimes all you need is a family of 50 styles and you can grab press attention). Here is a better modern slab: [Stag](http://web.archive.org/web/20150131042354/http:/www.christianschwartz.com/stag.shtml), which could be the basis for the _Men's Health_ typeface.

Nice one! I also really like what he did for The Guardian which is along the same line. [http://typographica.org/art/articles/2006/GdnEgypSans.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20150131042354/http:/typographica.org/art/articles/2006/GdnEgypSans.gif "http://typographica.org/art/articles/2006/GdnEgypSans.gif")

So since it doesn't look like I can license this – then what do I use?

Did you contact Schwartz? "Available for relicensing on a very limited basis. Contact us for more details."

There isn't much else in this realm other than what you mentioned. Maybe [FF Zine Slab](http://web.archive.org/web/20150131042354/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=Zine%20Slab), but that's heading another direction.
Oh! I was thinking of another Schwartz face, [Popular](http://web.archive.org/web/20150131042354/http:/www.christianschwartz.com/popular.shtml). You can ask Font Bureau about licensing.

Yeah that's it! Poplar. He makes some nice Slabs!

I really like the extra bold version of FF Zine, but it really lacks a light version, and I think the regular feels too condensed. However, for this project I might just buy the extra bold or black version of FF Zine.

I'm figuring that that's a lot cheaper than buying Poplar.

Some great suggestions from Stephen in this thread.  
Popular or FF Zine look like great options for you, Peter.

Regarding Soho, which I designed, it has been pretty well received  
thankfully and people might want to check out the bigger pdf at  
 [http://www.monotype.co.uk/soho/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150131042354/http:/www.monotype.co.uk/soho/ "http://www.monotype.co.uk/soho/") to make their own minds up.

It's a comprehensive pdf showing lots of text settings and  
stylistic alternatives for InDesign, if a particular letter  
or weight is not for you.

If some people just don't like the overall feel (refined industrial/  
mechanical) or whatever else, then there's not much I can do about  
that and fair enough. I love that aesthetic myself.

Thanks Seb – and also congratulations on having British GQ picking up Soho for their recent redesign. It looks great for that kind of magazine and I'm sure that a top title like GQ will get Soho even more attentiton.
Good news: [Stag is now available at Village](http://web.archive.org/web/20150131042354/http:/vllg.com/Schwartzco/Stag/mudTyper+Weights/).
